text: Data can downloaded year city. default (.e. arguments specified) 1% sample data cities recent available year returned. data tidy format, can quickly manipulated using dplyr verbs. example, analyze two years personal robberies Chicago Detroit, can run: can alternatively get simple features (SF) point object correct co-ordinates co-ordinate reference system (CRS) specified setting argument output = "sf". can used, example, quickly plot data.
code: library(crimedata)  crime_data <- get_crime_data() library(dplyr)  personal_robberies <- get_crime_data(   years = 2009:2010,    cities = c("Chicago", "Detroit"),    type = "core" ) %>%    filter(offense_type == "personal robbery") library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(lubridate)  get_crime_data(   cities = "Fort Worth",    years = 2014:2017,    type = "core",   output = "sf" ) %>%    filter(offense_group == "homicide offenses") %>%    mutate(offense_year = year(date_single)) %>%    ggplot() +    geom_sf() +   facet_wrap(vars(offense_year))

title: Get Data from the Open Crime Database — get_crime_data
text: default function returns one-percent sample 'core' data. default minimize accidentally requesting large files network. Setting type = "core" retrieves core fields (e.g. type, co-ordinates date/time offense) offense. data retrieved setting type = "extended" includes available fields provided police department city. extended data fields harmonized across cities, require cleaning types analysis. Requesting data (17 million rows) may lead problems memory capacity. Consider downloading smaller quantities data (e.g. using type = "sample") exploratory analysis. Setting output = "sf" returns data simple features format calling sf::st_as_sf(..., crs = 4326, remove = FALSE)
